The Revolutionaries is an upcoming Indian period action drama web series directed by Nikkhil Advani and set to premiere in 2026 on Amazon Prime Video. The series is based on the non-fiction book Revolutionaries: The Other Story Of How India Won Its Freedom by Sanjeev Sanyal, and explores the lives of young Indian freedom fighters who believed armed resistance was essential to ending British colonial rule.
Premise
Set during the Indian freedom struggle, the series focuses on a group of brave young revolutionaries who take up arms to fight against the British Raj. Highlighting their sacrifices, struggles, and unwavering patriotism, the show offers a dramatic retelling of their unsung contributions to India's independence movement.

*Javed Khan King

Production
The Revolutionaries is directed by Nikkhil Advani and produced by Monisha Advani and Madhu Bhojwani. The casting director is Kavish Sinha. The series is being shot on a grand scale, with filming currently underway across various Indian cities, including Mumbai, Amritsar, Varanasi, and Dehradun.
The production design is handled by Surabhi Verma, while the costume design is by Sakshi Goel. The art department includes Ankit Gupta, Rohit Nalawade, and Jainil Sachde. Lighting is led by gaffer Imsajidshaikh. Additional casting support is provided by Parag Chadha.
Release
The series is scheduled to premiere in 2026 and will stream exclusively on Amazon Prime Video. According to the official press note, it will be available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide.
Promotion
The first look of the series was revealed via Prime Video’s official Instagram handle. A 56-second teaser showcases the revolutionaries in disguises, engaging in underground resistance activities against British rule. Rohit Saraf is shown in a wrestling ground setting, while Bhuvan Bam sports a never-before-seen look. Pratibha Ranta, known for Laapataa Ladies, also appears as a fighter in the resistance.
Director’s Statement
Director Nikkhil Advani described the project as “a deeply enriching and enlightening experience,” crediting Sanjeev Sanyal’s book as a compelling foundation for telling these untold stories. He expressed gratitude to Prime Video for their continued support and praised the ensemble cast for “breathing life into these iconic characters.” Advani emphasized that the team is committed to crafting a narrative that is both authentic and impactful for global audiences.
